page.title: 05Kirmington school
page.content: An infant school was erected for the village in 1855 by the Earl of Yarb- ough.The first H.M.I.S. report was issued in 1876 when the roll was 50. A new school building with School masters house was built in 1883.The school remains in this building,with a modern toilet block and some very decorative brickwork. The school has 36 children with a preponderance of boys.The pupils come mainly from K. with a few from Croxton and other nearby villages.The school is in a picturesque environment with lots of play space,both grass and hard surface.The traditional curriculum is supplemented with squash,sailing and outdoor pursuits.School meals come from Ulceby.There is a Head master,who lives here,has a staff of 2/3 teachers It is organised with one junior (8_11) and one infant class (4_7years).
